alert.note: Alert for Carter; Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Carter and east central Powder River Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 228 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles north of Lightning Flat, or 25 miles southeast of Broadus, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rain may cause ponding of water on roadways and flood culverts and ditches. Locations impacted include... Boyes and Hammond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
